This is one of the best addons ever. Thank you so much for creating this, Tingle!

I feel as if I have done something wrong. I edited the PNG file that came from the DDS file which was a tex from sharedassets0. I placed it in the Kerbals folder of the Universereplacer folder in the Gamedata section. The PNG is called EVAHelmet1 in accordance with the texture list file in the addon. I loaded up the game, and I still have the vanilla helmet texture. What do?

Edited August 15, 2013 by Pyromaniacal
This is a must-have. I only retextured the Kerbals so far and it looks splendid!

Yep.. added to the post here (3rd entry)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/44135-0-21-x-Universe-Replacer-v3-2?p=587716&viewfull=1#post587716

If you want to modify these files, you need superPNG + Adobe Photoshop CS5 or thereabouts. Or GIMP.

All my files are under a complete "don't care what you do with it" license. Just for the record.

Yes i can. wait a second.
When we add a kerbal texture do we need helmet + suit or can we only make a helmet texture?

When we add a kerbal texture do we need helmet + suit or can we only make a helmet texture?

We need helmet + suit

When we add a kerbal texture do we need helmet + suit or can we only make a helmet texture?

If someone already made a suit you like there is nothing wrong with only making a fitting helmet... they can and should be interchanged, and with random kerbals it makes it more fun to not know every single texture that is in rotation

When we add a kerbal texture do we need helmet + suit or can we only make a helmet texture?

You don't need a set of anything, every texture is independently exchangeable.
Okay dokes. Thank you. Well then I am having problems with my helmet texture not being in game.

Okay dokes. Thank you. Well then I am having problems with my helmet texture not being in game.

Just grab some of the ones other people made to see how they did it Maybe you just spelled the texture name incorrectly, texture names are case sensitive and the texturelist.txt tells you how they have to be.

Ie, for helmets to show up, you have to actually name it EVAHelmet1 |EVAHelmet2 etc...

Just grab some of the ones other people made to see how they did it Maybe you just spelled the texture name incorrectly, texture names are case sensitive and the texturelist.txt tells you how they have to be.

Ie, for helmets to show up, you have to actually name it EVAHelmet1 |EVAHelmet2 etc...

Also don't forget, the texture path is case sensitive. That's from my experience at least.

Also, if you are running other mods like Kerbal Followers, they conflict with this mod and cause the textures to not show up. The only other mod that I know that has previously conflicted and then fixed the issue, was Kethane.
